priority_actions: Implement a monitoring and alerting system to track output quality and consistency.
Conduct regular audits of policy-as-code templates to ensure they are up-to-date and accurate.
Invest in training for the SRE team on best practices for policy-as-code development and maintenance.
suggestions: Implement a automated testing framework to ensure policy-as-code templates are functioning correctly.
Integrate a feedback mechanism into the policy-as-code system to allow for user input and correction of errors.
root_causes: Insufficient training and expertise within the SRE team
explanation: The decline in AI confidence and output quality suggests that the policy-as-code system may be experiencing issues related to outdated or inaccurate templates, and insufficient training and expertise within the SRE team. To address these issues, implementing a monitoring and alerting system, conducting regular audits of policy-as-code templates, and investing in training for the SRE team are recommended. Additionally, implementing automated testing framework and integrating feedback mechanism into the policy-as-code system can help improve output quality and consistency, as well as increase accuracy of SLI/SLO/Alert generation.
